page.title: 07FARMING WINTERBOURNE VALLEY
page.content: {CATTLE}Friesian cows milked in 5-8 per side pit-operated Herringbone Parlours Cows fed right ration of concentrates when transistor collar triggers off a computer.{General practice:} Hereford Bull running with heifers to produce 1st calves which are fattened for veal or beef.The best cows are artificially inseminated by the semen of proven Friesian sires kept at A.I. centres. Female progeny for herd replacements. Other cows kept in milk by calving to Hereford or Limosen bulls .Progeny are fattened.{SHEEP} Largest flock at Pen Barn.160 Scotch Halfbreds,600 Sc.Hbred crossed Suffolk ewes. 4 Suffolk and 11 Hampshire Down Rams.{PRACTICE} Scotch Hbred ewes X Suffolk ram. Progeny: Ram lambs are fattened & sold locally. Ewe lambs reared as flock replacements and crossed with Hampshire Down rams. ALL resulting progeny fattened for meat.
